summary: After upgrading from SDK v1.11.8 to v1.12.1, users experience 'Workflow task not found' errors on long-running workflows. The underlying cause appears to be performance degradation preventing workers from completing tasks within the 10-second timeout window.
userImpact: Users upgrading to newer SDK versions experience workflow failures and significant delays in activity processing, blocking production deployments.
rootCause: A memory leak bug in Worker configuration (fixed in v1.13.0 by PR #1777) causes increased garbage collection overhead, reducing worker performance and preventing task completion within timeout windows.
proposedFix: Upgrade to v1.13.0 or later which contains a fix for the memory leak bug that surfaces as performance degradation in certain Worker configurations.
workaround: Revert to SDK v1.11.8 until the performance regression is resolved in a newer version.
keyQuote: The Workflow task not found error is almost certainly just a secondary symptom; the real problem is that the Worker is not completing task within the allowed time
